markdownRemark.html:
Our mental picture of a place is based on our emotional response to that place.

Over the past few weeks, I’ve been hanging out around the city I consider home, Boise Idaho. I moved here at 18 to attend university and spent most of my early adult life here. It is a city that holds a special place in my heart and I always remember it with a certain glow.

Since I left, the city has undergone a major boom. Consistently rated as one of the best cities to live in the US, people have been flocking here to escape rising costs in coastal cities. With this influx of people, there has been a ton of construction that has transformed the city from what I remember.

This past weekend, as I sat in a new hip taco shop in the heart of downtown Boise, I realized the biggest reason this place has such a dear place in my heart comes from the community of people I was able to build while I lived here. Between college friendships and my first few professional friendships, there was always people around.
